bill_title: revise provisions related to the death penalty.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise provisions related to the death penalty. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 23A-27A-4 be amended to read as follows: 23A-27A-4. If, upon a trial by jury, a person is convicted of a Class A felony, a sentence of death shall may not be imposed unless the jury verdict at the presentence hearing includes a: (1) A finding of at least one aggravating circumstance and a; (2) A recommendation that such sentence be imposed; and (3) A finding that the defendant is too dangerous to be incarcerated and is an ongoing danger to the public and the prison community. If an aggravating circumstance is found and a recommendation of death is made, the court shall sentence the defendant to death. If a sentence of death is not recommended by the jury, the court shall sentence the defendant to life imprisonment. The provisions of this section shall do not affect a sentence when the case is tried without a jury or when a court accepts a plea of guilty. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
